transcript.text: in short it seems to me quite

provide direction for contemporary

concerning the nature of mind and more
specifically the nature of human
language our attention quite naturally
comes to focus on the 17th century quote
the century of genius end quote in which
the foundations of modern science were
firmly established and the problems that

remarkable Clarity and
piscu there are many far from

particularly crucial in the present

he had demonstrated that understanding
and will the two fundamental properties

phers who wrote A fascinating Treatise

just as it cannot explain the basic

Essence is thought alongside of body
with its essential properties of

environment interaction such a
psychology would contrast rather sharply

it is claimed must be those underlying

alternative and what is more its
